IActivityDisplay

enspire.interactivity.display.IActivityDisplay
enspire.interactivity.display.SimpleDDDisplay

3 other children

All activity displays must implement this interface.  The corresponding controller for any given activity will make a call to showActivity to kick off the display of the interactivity.  Each time that an activity is evaluated, the resulting IEvaluation is passed to the display, and it is the display’s job to appropriately display the results of the evaluation.

Functions

showActivity

function showActivity():Void

Called by the corresponding activity controller to kick off the displaying of the interactivity.  Normally, the implementation of this function should result in the attaching of clips (choices, etc), or the assignment of classes and functionality to on-stage assets (looping over mcDraggers, etc).

displayEvaluation

function displayEvaluation(e: IEvaluation):Void

After evaluating the state of an activity, we want the display to act appropriately upon the findings.  We send the resulting IEvaluation to the display, and the implementation of this function should appropriately change the appearance of the activity.  For example, in a drag and drop style activity.  The evaluation will contain references to the draggers that are incorrectly placed.  It is the responsibility of the activity display to return those draggers to their initial positions.
